page.title: 01South East of Stranraer
page.content: On the south east of Stranraer the land cuts into the block. Moving south east the terrain is composed of rolling fields of arable land. The majority of the block lies on the isthmus which connects the Rhins to the Machaars and is not above sea level. In square 12 of the block lies part of the runway of the adjoining 'West Freugh' airfield. The area is very flat with very few trees visible but it is noted that this land is a landing spot for wild geese coming from the north such as Pinkfeet, Greylags and Barnacles. Flowing through the block is 'Soulseat' and Piltanton Burns. There are secenteen farms in the area and a number of cottages housing mainly farm workers.
